title: FedRAMP Incident Requirements

content.content: When security incidents occur, FedRAMP compliance doesn't pause. You must know the critical reporting requirements and maintain compliance while managing the incident.
You have ONE HOUR from incident identification to notify: Agency AO (VA), FedRAMP PMO, and US-CERT. The clock starts when we identify the incident, not when it occurred.
Pete (as ISSO) handles these notifications using phone first, then email follow-up. Everyone should understand this urgency - it's not negotiable.
For incident categories and detailed procedures, refer to our Incident Response Plan.

items: Document all decisions and who made them
Record exact times for major actions

content.content: AWS Systems Manager Incident Manager tracks technical actions automatically, but human decisions need manual documentation.
If an incident reveals a vulnerability or control weakness, add it to the POA&M even after fixing it. This shows systematic issue resolution.

items: Prioritize keeping services available for veterans
Status updates every 2 hours during active incidents
No public statements without VA coordination

content.content: If choosing between perfect security logging and veteran access, keep the service running and document the decision.
